meanings.definition: To press or rub with the knuckles.
meanings.sent1: She was knuckling the dough to make it smooth.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys knuckling his friend's shoulder playfully.
meanings.sent3: The cat was knuckling the blanket as if kneading bread.
meanings.sent4: The old door was knuckling against the frame, refusing to open.
meanings.sent5: The boxer was knuckling the punching bag with determination.

meanings.definition: To bend or buckle at the knuckles.
meanings.sent1: His fingers were knuckling awkwardly as he tried to grip the ball.
meanings.sent2: The old book's spine was knuckling under the weight of time.
meanings.sent3: The tree branch was knuckling under the weight of the heavy snow.
meanings.sent4: The metal rod was knuckling under the pressure, starting to bend.
meanings.sent5: The rope was knuckling in the middle, showing signs of wear and tear.

meanings.definition: To submit or yield under pressure.
meanings.sent1: She was knuckling under the weight of her responsibilities.
meanings.sent2: The team was knuckling to the opponent's relentless attacks.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn lock was finally knuckling to the locksmith's skills.
meanings.sent4: The old bridge was knuckling under the force of the raging river.
meanings.sent5: The young tree was knuckling under the strong winds, bending but not breaking.
